snippet: In an interview, George Zimmerman, the neighborhood watchman charged in the killing of Trayvon Martin, apologized to Mr. Martin’s parents but said he did not regret his actions.
abstract: George Zimmerman, in an interview with Sean Hannity of Fox News, says he does not regret his actions that led to the killing of Trayvon Martin and that the teenager's death was part of 'God's plan;' Zimmerman does apologize to Martin's parents.
lead_paragraph: In an interview, George Zimmerman, the neighborhood watchman charged in the killing of Trayvon Martin, apologized to Mr. Martin’s parents but said he did not regret his actions.

headline.seo: Zimmerman Says No Regret for Actions in Trayvon Martin Shooting
headline.main: Zimmerman Says He Doesn’t Regret Actions in Shooting
headline.print_headline: Zimmerman Says He Doesn’t Regret Actions in Shooting
